Taiga linnorms are covered in hundreds of quill-like black spines as sharp as spears. Wise hunters native to linnorm-infested lands know to watch for spines stuck in the bark of conifers—a sure sign that a taiga linnorm has recently passed through. Sometimes this means of tracking isn't enough to avoid an encounter, however; taiga linnorms, like their tarn and tor brethren, are skilled stalkers. They prefer to lurk in half-frozen bogs or swampy marshlands with their heads poking just above the water's surface, ever watchful for unwary prey. **[Recall Knowledge - Dragon](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2)): DC 41 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 36 [Taiga Linnorm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=723) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 167 2.0 **Perception** +33; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent (imprecise) 60 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +33, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +37, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +35 **Str** +10 **Dex** +6 **Con** +8 **Int** -2 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +7 --- **AC** 44 **Fort** +35 **Ref** +31 **Will** +29 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 385 , regeneration 15 (deactivated by cold iron) **Immunities** [curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), electricity, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=145) **Weaknesses** cold iron 15 **Curse of Endless Storms** ([curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) When a creature slays a taiga linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 46 Will save or permanently gain weakness 20 to electricity.
**Spines** Any creature that makes a melee attack against a taiga linnorm is stabbed by the taiga linnorm's spines and takes 1d6 piercing damage per attack. A melee weapon with [reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192) protects the user against these spines.
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** Tail only. --- **Speed** 40 feet, fly 100 feet, swim 50 feet; [_freedom of movement_](/Spells.aspx?ID=128) **Melee** jaws +37 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 25 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d12+18 piercing plus taiga linnorm venom **Melee** claw +37 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 25 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d8+18 slashing **Melee** tail +37 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 5d6+18 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Primal Innate Spells** DC 41 - **Constant (8th)** [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) - **Constant (9th)** [Freedom of Movement](/Spells.aspx?ID=128) **Breath Weapon** ([Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The taiga linnorm breathes a 60.foot cone of electrified vapor, dealing 20d6 electricity damage to creatures in the area (DC 41 basic Reflex save). The electrified mist persists for 1d4 rounds, dealing 6d6 electricity damage (DC 41 basic Reflex save) to each creature that ends its turn in the mist. The taiga linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds. **Taiga Linnorm Venom** ([Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 42 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 10 rounds; **Stage 1** 7d6 electricity damage and [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) (1 round); **Stage 2** 10d6 electricity damage and drained 2 (1 round)
